comment.author: 97381978@N00
comment._content: That's an SE5 or SE5a, note the top wing mounted Lewis gun on a sliding Foster mount.

comment.author: 14456531@N07
comment._content: Thanks.  We've tagged the image with this info now.

comment.author: 34664244@N05
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Vintage People with Animals, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 13572710@N04
comment._content:
I found this after a chance discovery while researching WWI.  I was watching a film about the Battle of the Somme that a friend had recommended and I noticed one of the British divisions had a fox pup for a mascot.

It seems red foxes were a popular mascot for the British.
